title: Cartosat-2E
text:
Cartosat-2E is an <a href="Earth%20observation%20satellite">Earth observation satellite</a> developed by the <a href="Indian%20Space%20Research%20Organisation">Indian Space Research Organisation</a> (ISRO), and is the seventh in the <a href="Cartosat">Cartosat</a> series. It is designed to collect high-resolution, large-scale imagery for use in urban planning, infrastructure development, utilities planning, and traffic management.
Instruments.
Cartosat-2E carries three primary instruments: the Panchromatic Camera (PAN), the High-Resolution Multi-Spectral <a href="radiometer">radiometer</a> (HRMX), and the <a href="Event%20monitoring">Event Monitoring camera</a> (EvM).
Launch.
The satellite was launched on 23 June 2017, along with <a href="NIUSAT">NIUSAT</a> and 29 other satellites, aboard a <a href="Polar%20Satellite%20Launch%20Vehicle">PSLV-XL</a>, <a href="PSLV-C38">PSLV-C38</a> <a href="launch%20vehicle">launch vehicle</a> from the <a href="Satish%20Dhawan%20Space%20Centre">Satish Dhawan Space Centre First Launch Pad</a>. With a mass of , it is deployed into a <a href="Sun-synchronous%20orbit">Sun-synchronous orbit</a> for a five-year primary mission. India has allocated (US$25 million in 2017) for the project.
